column4: I downloaded xMule, and when I run ./configure, it says "checking for C++ compiler default output file name... configure: error: C++ compiler cannot create executables". In fact, all the ./configures I've run have thrown weird errors, usually about gcc or g++. What's going on?
Thanx, everyone! I'll try all those.
If Synaptic crashes, how do I allow apt-get to work? It says that it's locked, but I'm not sure what to unlock, or how to do it.
Remove some lock file. man apt will probably tell it to you.
